On 9/1/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
> 
> 
> The major advantage of this technique is that I can easily create
> tests for lots of valid names. If I'm reading it from a file, the list
> could be quite extensive _and_ you'll know which names passed the test
> and which names didn't.



Sure, but you're still simulating passing parameters to methods by passing 
them to your constructors. Not the most intuitive way.

Out of curiousity: any easy way to do this in TestNG?
> ("Parameterising" a list or a file name doesn't count; you wouldn't
> get the easy reporting of the bad values vs the good values).


Yes, with @Factory.

-- 
Ceric
